title: Tech
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Tech, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Alphabet is increasingly launching “moonshot” projects as independent companies — here’s why
items.description: Despite the emphasis on detachment from ideas, X employees do have significant skin in the game when projects spin out.

items.title: Kevin Rose’s simple test for AI hardware — would you want to punch someone in the face who’s wearing it?
items.description: "As an investor, you kind of have to not only say, okay, cool tech, sure, but emotionally, how does it make me feel? And how does it make others feel ...

items.title: Sam Altman says ‘enough’ to questions about OpenAI’s revenue
items.description: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman recently said that the company is doing “well more” than $13 billion in annual revenue — and he sounded a little testy when pres...

items.title: Google pulls Gemma from AI Studio after Senator Blackburn accuses model of defamation
items.description: Senator Martha Blackburn argued Gemma’s fabrications are “not a harmless ‘hallucination,’" but rather “an act of defamation produced and distributed b...

items.title: Sequoia’s Roelof Botha warns founders about chasing sky-high valuations as the firm doubles down on its selective approach
items.description: At Disrupt, Botha had advice for founders who are swimming in terms sheets right now.

items.title: AI researchers ’embodied’ an LLM into a robot – and it started channeling Robin Williams
items.description: AI researchers at Andon Labs embedded various LLMs in a vacuum robot to test how ready they were to be embodied. And hilarity ensued.

items.title: Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong trolls the prediction markets
items.description: While Armstrong may have helped some Kalshi and Polymarket users make a little money, he was also illustrating how easily these markets can be manipul...

items.title: 35 Best Family Board Games (2025): Catan, Ticket to Ride, Codenames
items.description: From monsters to kittens to strategy games, these sets will liven things up on nights when everyone is tired of screens.

items.title: Elon Musk wants you to know that Sam Altman got a refund for his Tesla Roadster
items.description: Elon Musk and Sam Altman are still taking swipes at each other on Musk’s social media platform X.

items.title: Rising energy prices put AI and data centers in the crosshairs
items.description: A majority of consumers say they’re worried about data centers driving up electricity costs. Is the industry prepared for a possible backlash?
